text: Hi, anyone know why I can´t create a contact with request register?
Hey <@UHGJ1MN14> this might be a dumb question but do you have a property in that HubSpot account that Registration Action column could map to?

By default there's a 90-day limit, however, if you're actively using it... it automatically renews <@UK3D64BRN> <@U7SL518D6>.

If there is zero activity in a 90 day window... it will send you some emails... then if no response, it will close.
Welcome <@UJZ3QF9CH> - we're really excited to have you a part of our developer community! :sprocket::bmo:

Great to hear you're learning it <@UK6SBHRB6> - we're really excited to have you in our community :hamsterdance::bmo:

How is your HubSpot CMS experience going?

Hey <@UJX9VEVAL> - welcome to the :sprocket: developer community. We're really excited to have you a part of it. :smiley:

People in the HubSpot community are VERY happy to help each other and share ideas. I'm sure others will be excited to help you. :slightly_smiling_face:

I'd suggest coming up with some specific questions and posting in <#C22PU4LV8|general> to get started.

Great to hear you're investing in your education and we're excited to have you in our :sprocket: community! :smiley::clapping:

Once you feel good about HTML and CSS, I'd suggest reviewing the CMS for Developers Certification (<https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers>) and the (new, beta) Code Gallery (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery>) for building on HubSpot.

The key is to learn HubL and HubDB... once you know those, it opens a TON of possibility. :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>, I trying to use the instructions below, but none worked me
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/partner-tools/how-to-use-the-partner-lead-registration-card> (I can´t found the option register)
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/partner-tools/how-can-i-bulk-register-my-leads-in-my-HubSpot-partner-account> (I can´t set the column request register)

HI <@UK8GTRTU0> - It's really great to have you and your team in the :sprocket: developer community. We're excited to have you here :bmo::hamsterdance::smiley:

How has your HubSpot experience been so far? :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah ok, for that stuff, you’ll want to contact your Channel Account Manager. You’re portal may not be a partner account (those are specific to our partner program)

>"Let's see if I can help and be helped"
Love this - that's what the :sprocket: community is all about... helping everyone grow together.

We're excited to have you a part of our community. :bmo:
Hi <@UK3HG5B33> - Welcome to the HubSpot :sprocket: Developer Community. We're really excited to have you a part of it. Let us know if you have any questions.

What's up <@UK4GN1E14> :wave: We're excited to have you a part of the :sprocket: HubSpot Developer community.

How is your HubSpot development experience going so far? :slightly_smiling_face:
Thankyou <@UFBNA9K9A>, It's necessary have partner account, to contacts can login in cms or exist other way?

It’s actually neither.  Logging in on the CMS is an Enterprise feature of HubSpot’s Marketing Hub. For example if you had some content that only your customers should have access, you can create a gated area of your website hosted on HubSpot using that Enterprise feature. However, if you want to registers leads so that you might be eligible for compensation from HubSpot in the event they become a customer, that’s what you need a partner account for
You mention that if I only have the Enterprise version, I can only restrict the hearing by password, but if I have a member account, can I restrict it by username and password?
“member account” isn’t a term I’m familiar with, can you DM me your portal ID and I can see how you are set up?
so that portal is in an Enterprise trial right now, which is why you are able to see that option
yeah
But in other account enterprise, I don't see that options
What is that account’s ID, I can look it up for you

Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>, I found the issue with my portal of testing, the portal aren't connect with mail domain, that's why didn't work me this tutorial
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cms-pages-editor/control-audience-access-to-pages#control-audience-access-to-pages>
Great, sorry for the not catching that.  Really appreciate you following up here so others can benefit as well
